alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Pettis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 10:02PM CDT until May 07 at 7:32PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri... Blackwater River at Valley City affecting Johnson MO and Pettis Counties. For the Blackwater River...including Valley City...Moderate flooding is forecast. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Blackwater River at Valley City. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Woodlands and farm fields along the river begin to flood. At 25.0 feet, County Highway E near Valley City and Highway 23 near the Perry State Wildlife Area are under water. At 31.0 feet, Extensive flooding of rural property and many roads occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 29.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
